record.title: OFFERING HEARTFELT CONDOLENCES TO THE VICTIMS AND THEIR FAMILIES REGARDING THE HORRIFIC VIOLENCE AT VIRGINIA TECH AND TO STUDENTS, FACULTY, ADMINISTRATION AND STAFF AND THEIR FAMILIES WHO HAVE BEEN AFFECTED
record.chair: The unfinished business is the vote on the motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, H. Res. 306, on which the yeas and nays were ordered.
record.narrative: The Clerk read the title of the resolution.
record.chair: The question is on the motion offered by the gentleman from Virginia (Mr. Scott) that the House suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, H. Res. 306.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. Speaker, because I was attending a funeral at West Point this morning, I missed rollcall No. 221, adoption of H. Res. 306: Offering heartfelt condolences to the victims and their families regarding the horrific violence at Virginia Tech in Blacksburg, Virginia. Had I been present, I would have voted "yea."
